markdown.headingText: Read the CSV file into a data frame
markdown.markdown:
This final project utilized the 2015-2022 Alzheimer's Disease and Healthy Aging Data from the CDC Division of Population Health's Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) to evaluate mental health struggles in people with Alzheimer's Disease. The results showed that individuals in the Southern states reported the highest percentages of frequent mental distress and lifetime diagnosis of depression. Of all the racial/ethnic groups, Native American/Alaskan Natives reported the highest rates of frequent mental distress (18.5%) and lifetime diagnosis of depression (25.1%). You can download the PDF version of the report [here](PM-566-FINAL.pdf). ```{r} data <- read.csv("/Users/erinyu/Desktop/USC/MPH/Fall 2024/Health Data (PM 566)/Alzheimer_s_Disease_and_Healthy_Aging_Data.csv") ``` ```{r} # Create a subset of the data where Class is "Mental Health" mental_health_data <- subset(data, Class == "Mental Health") ``` ```{r} # Remove rows with NA in Data_Value clean_mentalhealth_data <- mental_health_data[!is.na(mental_health_data$Data_Value), ] ``` This is an interactive table reporting the average percentage reporting frequent mental distress by each state. ```{r} # Load necessary libraries library(dplyr) library(DT) # Filter for "Frequent mental distress" under Topic and calculate the mean percentage summarized_data <- clean_mentalhealth_data %>% filter(Topic == "Frequent mental distress") %>% group_by(LocationDesc) %>% summarize( `Mean percentage` = mean(Data_Value, na.rm = TRUE) ) %>% rename(State = LocationDesc) # Rename column header to "State" # Create an interactive table with a custom title datatable( summarized_data, options = list( pageLength = 10, # Show 10 rows per page autoWidth = TRUE # Adjust column widths ), caption = htmltools::tags$caption( style = "caption-side: top; text-align: center; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold;", "Mean Percentage Reporting Frequent Mental Distress by State" ) ) ``` This is a heat map of the mean percentages reporting frequent mental distress by state. ```{r} library(leaflet) library(dplyr) library(tigris) library(sf) options(tigris_use_cache = TRUE) # Filter and calculate mean percentages summarized_data <- clean_mentalhealth_data %>% filter(Topic == "Frequent mental distress") %>% group_by(LocationDesc) %>% summarize(Mean_Percentage = mean(Data_Value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% rename(State = LocationDesc) # Rename for easier matching # Load state boundaries (simplified for efficiency) states <- tigris::states(cb = TRUE, class = "sf") # Ensure state names match by converting to uppercase summarized_data <- summarized_data %>% mutate(State = toupper(State)) # Join state shapefile with summarized data states_data <- states %>% mutate(NAME = toupper(NAME)) %>% # Ensure NAME matches State left_join(summarized_data, by = c("NAME" = "State")) # Create a Leaflet map and add a centered title leaflet(data = states_data) %>% addPolygons( fillColor = ~colorQuantile("YlOrRd", Mean_Percentage)(Mean_Percentage), weight = 1, opacity = 1, color = "white", dashArray = "3", fillOpacity = 0.7, highlight = highlightOptions( weight = 2, color = "#666", dashArray = "", fillOpacity = 0.7, bringToFront = TRUE ), label = ~paste(NAME, "
", "Mean %: ", round(Mean_Percentage, 2)) ) %>% addLegend( "bottomright", pal = colorQuantile("YlOrRd", domain = states_data$Mean_Percentage, n = 5), values = ~Mean_Percentage, title = "Mean % Reporting Frequent Mental Distress", opacity = 1 ) %>% # Add title as a top-left control with custom HTML and CSS addControl( html = "
Mean Percentage Reporting Frequent Mental Distress by State
", position = "topleft" ) ``` This is an interactive table reporting the average percentages of individuals reporting a lifetime diagnosis of depression by state ```{r} # Load necessary libraries library(dplyr) library(DT) # Filter for "Lifetime diagnosis of depression" under Topic and calculate the mean percentage summarized_depression_data <- clean_mentalhealth_data %>% filter(Topic == "Lifetime diagnosis of depression") %>% group_by(LocationDesc) %>% summarize( `Mean percentage` = mean(Data_Value, na.rm = TRUE) ) %>% rename(State = LocationDesc) # Rename column header to "State" # Create an interactive table with a custom title datatable( summarized_depression_data, options = list( pageLength = 10, # Show 10 rows per page autoWidth = TRUE # Adjust column widths ), caption = htmltools::tags$caption( style = "caption-side: top; text-align: center; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold;", "Mean Percentage Reporting Lifetime Diagnosis of Depression by State" ) ) ``` This is a heat map of the mean percentages reporting lifetime diagnosis of depression by state. ```{r} library(leaflet) library(dplyr) library(tigris) library(sf) options(tigris_use_cache = TRUE) # Filter and calculate mean percentages for Lifetime Diagnosis of Depression summarized_data <- clean_mentalhealth_data %>% filter(Topic == "Lifetime diagnosis of depression") %>% group_by(LocationDesc) %>% summarize(Mean_Percentage = mean(Data_Value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% rename(State = LocationDesc) # Rename for easier matching # Load state boundaries (simplified for efficiency) states <- tigris::states(cb = TRUE, class = "sf") # Ensure state names match by converting to uppercase summarized_data <- summarized_data %>% mutate(State = toupper(State)) # Join state shapefile with summarized data states_data <- states %>% mutate(NAME = toupper(NAME)) %>% # Ensure NAME matches State left_join(summarized_data, by = c("NAME" = "State")) # Create a Leaflet map for Lifetime Diagnosis of Depression leaflet(data = states_data) %>% addPolygons( fillColor = ~colorQuantile("YlOrRd", Mean_Percentage)(Mean_Percentage), weight = 1, opacity = 1, color = "white", dashArray = "3", fillOpacity = 0.7, highlight = highlightOptions( weight = 2, color = "#666", dashArray = "", fillOpacity = 0.7, bringToFront = TRUE ), label = ~paste(NAME, "
", "Mean %: ", round(Mean_Percentage, 2)) ) %>% addLegend( "bottomright", pal = colorQuantile("YlOrRd", domain = states_data$Mean_Percentage, n = 5), values = ~Mean_Percentage, title = "Mean % Diagnosed with Depression", opacity = 1 ) %>% # Add title as a top-left control with custom HTML and CSS addControl( html = "
Mean Percentage Diagnosed with Depression by State
", position = "topleft" ) ```

This final project utilized the 2015-2022 Alzheimer's Disease and Healthy Aging Data from the CDC Division of Population Health's Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) to evaluate mental health struggles in people with Alzheimer's Disease. The results showed that individuals in the Southern states reported the highest percentages of frequent mental distress and lifetime diagnosis of depression. ", "Mean %: ", round(Mean_Percentage, 2)) ) %>% addLegend( "bottomright", pal = colorQuantile("YlOrRd", domain = states_data$Mean_Percentage, n = 5), values = ~Mean_Percentage, title = "Mean % Reporting Frequent Mental Distress", opacity = 1 ) %>% # Add title as a top-left control with custom HTML and CSS addControl( html = "
Mean Percentage Reporting Frequent Mental Distress by State
", position = "topleft" ) ``` This is an interactive table reporting the average percentages of individuals reporting a lifetime diagnosis of depression by state ```{r} # Load necessary libraries library(dplyr) library(DT) # Filter for "Lifetime diagnosis of depression" under Topic and calculate the mean percentage summarized_depression_data <- clean_mentalhealth_data %>% filter(Topic == "Lifetime diagnosis of depression") %>% group_by(LocationDesc) %>% summarize( `Mean percentage` = mean(Data_Value, na.rm = TRUE) ) %>% rename(State = LocationDesc) # Rename column header to "State" # Create an interactive table with a custom title datatable( summarized_depression_data, options = list( pageLength = 10, # Show 10 rows per page autoWidth = TRUE # Adjust column widths ), caption = htmltools::tags$caption( style = "caption-side: top; text-align: center; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold;", "Mean Percentage Reporting Lifetime Diagnosis of Depression by State" ) ) ``` This is a heat map of the mean percentages reporting lifetime diagnosis of depression by state. ```{r} library(leaflet) library(dplyr) library(tigris) library(sf) options(tigris_use_cache = TRUE) # Filter and calculate mean percentages for Lifetime Diagnosis of Depression summarized_data <- clean_mentalhealth_data %>% filter(Topic == "Lifetime diagnosis of depression") %>% group_by(LocationDesc) %>% summarize(Mean_Percentage = mean(Data_Value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% rename(State = LocationDesc) # Rename for easier matching # Load state boundaries (simplified for efficiency) states <- tigris::states(cb = TRUE, class = "sf") # Ensure state names match by converting to uppercase summarized_data <- summarized_data %>% mutate(State = toupper(State)) # Join state shapefile with summarized data states_data <- states %>% mutate(NAME = toupper(NAME)) %>% # Ensure NAME matches State left_join(summarized_data, by = c("NAME" = "State")) # Create a Leaflet map for Lifetime Diagnosis of Depression leaflet(data = states_data) %>% addPolygons( fillColor = ~colorQuantile("YlOrRd", Mean_Percentage)(Mean_Percentage), weight = 1, opacity = 1, color = "white", dashArray = "3", fillOpacity = 0.7, highlight = highlightOptions( weight = 2, color = "#666", dashArray = "", fillOpacity = 0.7, bringToFront = TRUE ), label = ~paste(NAME, "
", "Mean %: ", round(Mean_Percentage, 2)) ) %>% addLegend( "bottomright", pal = colorQuantile("YlOrRd", domain = states_data$Mean_Percentage, n = 5), values = ~Mean_Percentage, title = "Mean % Diagnosed with Depression", opacity = 1 ) %>% # Add title as a top-left control with custom HTML and CSS addControl( html = "
Mean Percentage Diagnosed with Depression by State
", position = "topleft" ) ```
